III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The child placing agency program will be housed inside the administrative office
building of Judson Center in Royal Oak, Michigan. The foster care and certification
offices will be located in a single concentrated area in the building. A visit room for
family visits is located near the staff offices. A conference room, meeting spaces, and
locked cabinets are also located near the staff offices. The building is a one-story
building, with ample parking, and is well-maintained. There is a sprinkler system in the
event of fire. On the grounds of the administrative offices are three additional separate
buildings, where other Judson Center services are provided. One of these buildings is
currently being prepared to house the foster care and certification programs. Once the
preparations are complete, the space will be inspected by the consultant, and an
addendum to this report will be completed. The space in the administrative building is
sufficient for the foster care and certification programs to conduct business and to
provide services to children and to families. The adoption services for Child Safe will be
provided primarily in Judson’s Redford, Michigan office; which already holds a separate
child placing agency license. Adoption workers will work in both the Redford and Royal
Oak offices.
2

B. Program Description
Child Safe of Michigan, an affiliate of Judson Center, will provide comprehensive foster
care services, certification services, as well as adoption evaluation and placement
services. The Chief Administrator will split time between the Royal Oak and Redford
offices. A foster care supervisor and certification supervisor are in place, as well as
sufficient foster care, certification, and adoption staff and supervisor. The Agency will
contract with DHS to provide services to include placement and supervision in foster
care, adoption evaluation and placement. The Agency will recruit, train, and assess
foster families; as well as provide other necessary certification services. Documentation
including the Agency’s organization chart, current budget, and non-profit status were
reviewed. Agency policies and procedures were reviewed and were found to be in
compliance with necessary rules and statutes.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no rule or statutory violations.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a provisional license to this child placing agency, private.
